ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Resists [was: Finally :)]
ygData.msgSnippet: Another thing about raids that I learned not long ago... If your guild has a raid planned, and some folks are already there (kind of like apick-up group), DO
ygData.messageBody:
Another thing about raids that I learned not long ago... If your guild has a
raid planned, and some folks are already there (kind of like apick-up
group), DO NOT GO! :op 8 full groups, and everyone died (and we were led
through the pit , of all places). IIRC, the raid leader's entire strategy
came from the movie Ghostbusters... "Get her!" Oy vey.

Back to the topic though, with singing Elemental Rhythms and some cleric
buffs, my resists were all near 200 and she laid not a single spell on me.
Claws and teeth on the other hand...

-=B=-
The Rathe
----- Original Message -----
From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <garramone@...>
To: <eqbards@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, March 24, 2001 9:52 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Resists [was: Finally :)]


> level is the most important resist item. so the lower level you are, the
> higher you want your resists at. generally an unbuffed 100CR or 100FR is
> good for vox or nag, respectively.
>
> Shada [Retired]
>
> > Btw what would you all consider the minimum resist gear for a
> > bard of 47th
> > level to wear at a nag/vox raid?
> > Currently I dont have anything special in the ways of resists...
> >
> > Musiker, Bertox
